Sentencas: Phase transformation of 1 mol% NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) under SOFC operation atmospheres was analyzed by in situ Raman spectroscopy with simultaneous measurement of conductivity using a test cell consisting of air, Pt/NiO doped YSZ/Pt, wet Ar balanced 50 vol% H-2.
Titulo: In situ analysis on the electrical conductivity degradation of NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia electrolyte by micro-Raman spectroscopy

Sentencas: In situ measurement was carried out under open circuit voltage (OCV) condition at 1173K for more than 20 h. Phase transformation from the cubic to the tetragonal phase progressively proceeded from the matting surface of the electrolyte on the anode side with increasing holding time.
Titulo: In situ analysis on the electrical conductivity degradation of NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia electrolyte by micro-Raman spectroscopy

Sentencas: Simultaneously, the electrical conductivity of the electrolyte also exhibited monotonically decrease from about 0.103 S cm(-1) to 0.084 S cm(-1).
Titulo: In situ analysis on the electrical conductivity degradation of NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia electrolyte by micro-Raman spectroscopy

Sentencas: The phase transformation started from the anode/electrolyte interface.
Titulo: In situ analysis on the electrical conductivity degradation of NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia electrolyte by micro-Raman spectroscopy

Sentencas: The tetragonal to cubic phase volume ratio evaluated from the Raman spectra, rapidly decreased with increasing depth from the anode/electrolyte interface towards the center of the electrolyte.
Titulo: In situ analysis on the electrical conductivity degradation of NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia electrolyte by micro-Raman spectroscopy

Sentencas: We have experimentally demonstrated by the in situ measurement that the conductivity degradation of NiO doped YSZ is closely associated to the phase transformation under a reducing condition at a high temperature.
Titulo: In situ analysis on the electrical conductivity degradation of NiO doped yttria stabilized zirconia electrolyte by micro-Raman spectroscopy
